snippet: The estimate of growth in the third quarter was revised to a 3.6 percent rate from 2.8 percent, with much of the gain attributed to inventory changes and an improving trade picture.
abstract: Commerce Department revises nation's estimated third-quarter gross domestic product to 3.6 percent from 2.8 percent; economists respond to better-than-expected data by cutting their estimates for fourth-quarter growth.

byline.contributor: Stephen Castle, Julia Werdigier and Jack Ewing contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The estimate of growth in the third quarter was revised to a 3.6 percent rate from 2.8 percent, with much of the gain attributed to inventory changes and an improving trade picture.

headline.main: Faster Pace of Growth May Not Last Long
headline.print_headline: Faster Pace Of Growth May Not Last Long
